arm_group.description: All patients over 18 years with diagnosed diabetes mellitus type II.
Patients over 18 years with no known diabetes mellitus or other known/diagnosed vascular diseases.

brief_summary.textblock:
Vascular damage caused by diabetes mellitus, cigarette smoking, age and arterial
      hypertension theoretically changes pulse wave velocity.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diabetes Mellitus - A Diagnosis Trial by Means of Non Invasive Measurements

detailed_description.textblock:
Diabetes mellitus related vascular alterations are associated with an increased risk of
      hypertonia, atherosclerosis, neuropathy, diabetic retinopathy, and further more.

      Increased vascular rigidity, which is based on the increased stiffness of vessels caused by
      vascular damage leads to an increase of pulse wave velocity. This assumption is based on the
      Moens-Korteweg-equation which is calculated using the modus of arterial vessel elasticity,
      arterial vessel wall thickness, the arterial radius and blood viscosity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients over 18 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Diabetic foot gangrene

          -  No possibility of pulse wave velocitiy measurement on the finger or toe

study_pop.textblock:
50 patients over 18 years with diagnosed type II diabetes mellitus are included into the
        diabetes group.

        50 healthy patients with no known or diagnosed diabetes mellitus or damage of the vessels
        are included into the non diabetes group.

clinical_study.official_title: Diabetes Mellitus - A Diagnosis Trial by Means of Non Invasive Measurements

primary_outcome.description: The pulse wave is recorded by plethysmography using a pulse-oximeter and a continuous noninvasive arterial blood pressure measurement (CNAP-500) device, both on the finger and toe. The time between these 4 recorded waves is then calculated. The influence of age, duration of known arterial hypertension, cigarette smoking (pack-years) and diabetes mellitus.
primary_outcome.measure: Pulse wave arrival time difference between finger and toe, duration of diabetes
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 Minute data recording of the pulse waves at four sites.
